channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-8035] Add site target check to precommit tests
item.description: We should check that the Maven 'site' target passes as part of precommit testing. See HBASE-8022.
item.summary: Add site target check to precommit tests

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: This adds site validation to test-patch.sh
Committed to trunk. I am trying to debug a site build issue now over on 0.95. This could help find the issues earlier. Thanks Nick.
Oh, my issues was hidden because we have been failing tests in 0.95 and trunk so long... only now does it come to light now tests are starting to pass again.

Integrated in HBase-TRUNK-on-Hadoop-2.0.0 #437 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK-on-Hadoop-2.0.0/437/)
HBASE-8035 Add site target check to precommit tests (Revision 1454548)

Result = FAILURE
stack :
Files :

  • /hbase/trunk/dev-support/test-patch.sh

I think we should use something similar to the command on Jenkins:

-PrunAllTests -Dmaven.test.redirectTestOutputToFile=true package assembly:assembly site -Prelease

If I issue 'mvn clean compile site -DskipTests' under trunk, I get:


[ERROR] Failed to execute goal on project hbase-server: Could not resolve dependencies for project org.apache.hbase:hbase-server:jar:0.97-SNAPSHOT: The following artifacts could not be resolved: org.apache.hbase:hbase-common:jar:0.97-SNAPSHOT, org.apache.hbase:hbase-protocol:jar:0.97-SNAPSHOT, org.apache.hbase:hbase-client:jar:0.97-SNAPSHOT, org.apache.hbase:hbase-prefix-tree:jar:0.97-SNAPSHOT, org.apache.hbase:hbase-common:jar:tests:0.97-SNAPSHOT, org.apache.hbase:hbase-hadoop-compat:jar:0.97-SNAPSHOT, org.apache.hbase:hbase-hadoop-compat:jar:tests:0.97-SNAPSHOT, org.apache.hbase:hbase-hadoop1-compat:jar:0.97-SNAPSHOT, org.apache.hbase:hbase-hadoop1-compat:jar:tests:0.97-SNAPSHOT: Could not find artifact org.apache.hbase:hbase-common:jar:0.97-SNAPSHOT in cloudbees netty (http://repository-netty.forge.cloudbees.com/snapshot/) -> [Help 1]

This addendum seems to work.
But I wonder if the additional time (4 min) is worth it.


[INFO] BUILD SUCCESS

[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------

[INFO] Total time: 4:16.466s

[INFO] Finished at: Fri Mar 08 17:29:58 PST 2013

Yeah, the compile step probably works for me because I've run `mvn packge install` on trunk.

+1 for Ted's addendum.

What is up on jenkins is kinda useless... it builds an assembly and then after builds the site (so assembly does not contain doc..... its of no use). I am currently trying to fix it but putting 'site' anywhere but on the end breaks the build.

The addendum builds an assembly which is a pretty useless exercise I'd say... in a hadoopqa patch test.

We just want to see if patch breaks doc building...

Looking at original patch again, we don't need the compile goal in there.. but its fine with it.
I believe compile goal is necessary because site implies javadoc, and docbook depends on resources copied into target by compile...
Take Maven out back and shoot.
It looks like we could have the pre-patch script instead call xml:validate: http://mojo.codehaus.org/xml-maven-plugin/validate-mojo.html

I believe compile goal is necessary because site implies javadoc, and docbook depends on resources copied into target by compile...

You are right. Site runs javadoc but it will be missing the above (unless we make sure they are included by they copy-resources plugin triggered by pre-site).

Not important though.

Can we close this issue then; the patch has been applied?
Looks like the addendum has not been applied.
I think the addendum is useless doing nothing but using up more space on jenkins.

Looking through recent QA reports, site check all failed.
We should do something before closing this issue.
For sure would be good to know why site failed.

https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/4758//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/patchSiteOutput.txt

With the existing `clean compile site -DskipTests`, site didn't fail, the subsequent module builds do, which goes back to the compile vs package business.
I run it locally and the exit code is 0
Nick Dimiduk Sorry, your script has `clean compile site -DskipTests` in it... how do we get to the 'compile vs package business'? (I missed that there is a siteOutput.... nice)

This appears to work. `mvn -N clean site -DskipTests` builds the docbook locally for me, and skips the walk through submodules. It complains loudly when I first `rm -r ~/.m2/repository/org/apache/hbase/hbase*/0.97-SNAPSHOT` but doesn't fail the build. The build succeeds and just creates docbook.

[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------

[INFO] BUILD SUCCESS

[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------

[INFO] Total time: 43.186s
Attaching new addendum patch.

When run w/o a compile or package included in the command, maven will attempt to resolve build artifacts from external repositories. This happens after the docbook step completes; I don't know why. It can't find 0.97-SNAPSHOT anything, but it doesn't result in an error when run with -N. See also Ted Yu's comments about compile/package.

Makes sense I suppose. So, I think the addendum good since it checks our site target only which I think is what we want since elsewhere the other stuff (compile, unit tests) are checked. The site will run javadoc target. We are doing it twice now then? Once to look for javadoc warnings and again here when we do site build?

If I do this:

MAVEN_OPTS=" -Xmx3g" mvn -DskipTests site -U

It works for me.

The site will run javadoc target. We are doing it twice now then?

Correction. This invocation does not run javadoc, at least in my sandbox. The javadoc aggregation step appears to do nothing at all, and the site phase appears to not mind. I've attached the output for inspection.
So, which addendum should we use ?

Trying this... removing 'clean'. Maybe we won't try downloading jars already in place (I can't repro this mvn behavior locally; all runs fine for me). If this don't work, will just add the -N flag Nick Dimiduk suggests above.
Committed addendum.

Adding -N as nick suggested (though we are going to have to figure what is going on here soon... I've seen it when i try to build an assembly up on jenkins also). Committing this for now to get site green again.
Committed.

Integrated in HBase-TRUNK #3974 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/3974/)

HBASE-8035 Add site target check to precommit tests; ANOTHER ADDENDUM (Revision 1458547)
HBASE-8035 Add site target check to precommit tests – ADDENDUM (Revision 1458507)

Result = FAILURE
stack :
Files :

  • /hbase/trunk/dev-support/test-patch.sh

stack :
Files :

  • /hbase/trunk/dev-support/test-patch.sh
Site target check is still red in QA report.

Ted Yu Thank you for the useless echo of publicly available knowledge made above.

Adding the -N made site plugin pass for a while.

"HBASE-8186 Untether javadoc and site build" removed the -N since it a band-aid and the thought was that javadoc aggregate target was what was causing our need of -N (Builds were working for me w/o the -N locally after I was able to reproduce the original site fail). Site precheck is now failing again in a manner simmilar to the original but on hbase-common mondule rather than in hbase-server. I'm working on our build/packaging in general and will try address this issue as part of it all.
This has been working for som time. Resolving.
Closing this issue after 0.99.0 release.
